title: Postcards For Sale - Moved to Ebay - 7-19
author: Greenmonster

posts.post_title: Postcards For Sale - Moved to Ebay - 7-19
posts.post_content:
The following postcards are available for sale.  Please use PayPal Friends and Family for payment or send check/MO.  Also confirm with me via PM, that the item is still available before sending payment. All are pricing is postpaid.  


1913 Real Photo Postcard, Comiskey Park, Chicago White Sox, May 17 1913 view, Frank Chance Day.  Light image, slight paper loss along bottom border, postmarked 1913, likely one of a kind RP postcard - $[STRIKE]350.00[/STRIKE] $300.00

1909 Real Photo Postcard by Wilkerson, "Greetings From Washington Heights New York" includes the Polo Grounds bottom right, uncommon Wilkerson postcard, postmarked 1909 - [STRIKE]$500.00[/STRIKE] $400.00


1910 Toledo Mud Hens Baseball Team, sepia postcard, Managed by Ducky Holmes, this team included future MLB players: Fred Abbott, Jim Baskette, Kid Butler, Dave Callahan, Bill Essick, Jerry Freeman, Bill Hallman, Grover Hartley, Charlie Hickman, Harry Hinchman, Grover Land, Joe McCarthy (HOF),  Frank Owen, Denny Sullivan, Hi West, Earl Yingling and Guy Zinn.  I have not done the research to determine which of these players are pictured on this postcard.  Postmarked 1910, slight corner/edge wear, no creases - [STRIKE]$250.00[/STRIKE] $200.00

1946 Boston Red Sox Team picture postcard, by Fay Foto, uncommon postcard, includes Ted Williams, postmarked, no creases - [STRIKE]$150.00[/STRIKE] $125.00

1950 Boston Red Sox real photo postcard, Payne Park, this is the only copy I've come across, - $200.00

C1920 Boston Red Sox, Fenway Park real photo postcard, grandstand area, players identified, includes Harry Hooper, probably one of a kind - $750.00

C1920 (?) Cincinnati Reds, Crosley Field real photo postcard, Eppa Rixey pitching, postcard measures 3.1875 X 5.4375, may be slightly trimmed or produced at this size, unused, no creases, another one of a kind - $950.00




.

[quote name="Angyale" post=1996020]If still available.

Eric[/QUOTE]


Sorry, sold
I’ll take the YS post card.
